'''Aragost''' ({{TA|2431}}<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, p. 196</ref> - {{TA|2588|n}},<ref name="North">{{App|North}}</ref> age 157) was the eighth [[Chieftain of the Dúnedain]], succeeding his father, [[Arahad I]], when he died in {{TA|2523|n}}.

==History==
Aragost's rule was uneventful due to the enemy's forces being concentrated against [[Gondor]] and  [[Rhovanion]]. Aragost died in 2588 - after having ruled for 65 years - and was followed by his son, [[Aravorn]].<ref name="North"/>

==Etymology==
''Aragost'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but the Association Tolkiendil suggests it means "Royal Dread".<ref name=Tolkiendil>{{webcite|author=Association Tolkiendil|articleurl=https://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names|articlename=Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth|website=Tolkiendil|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref> It is probably a compound of the prefix ''[[ara|ar(a)-]]'' ("noble", "royal", "high") and ''gost'' ("dread", "terror").<ref name=Tolkiendil/><ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-4071677551.html|articlename=S. ''Aragost'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 341</ref>

In an early manuscript Aragost's name was "Arandost".<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, Commentary, p. 211</ref>
